H0.text: Plants help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H1.text: Flowers help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H2.text: Bacteria are the organisms that help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H3.text: Animals help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

A4.text: The roots of the plants bind the soil together, and interweave with other roots, forming a more solid mass that is less susceptible to both water and wind erosion.

A5.text: The removal of vegetation increases the rate of surface erosion.
